[[Felaróf]]) | race=[[Horses|Horse]] | gender=Male | height= | hair=''white'' | eyes= | clothing= | weapons= | steed= }} '''Nahar''' was the legendary horse ridden by [[Oromë]], the [[Huntsman of the Valar]]. Nahar's coat was said to be white under the [[Sun]], but to shimmer in silver in the night,{{S|IIb}} and his feet were shod in gold.{{S|Captivity}} ==History== In {{YT|1085}}{{MR|P2a}} Oromë was riding and hunting east near the [[Orocarni]] when Nahar gave a great neighing and stood still. Wondering, Oromë too went still and heard afar the singing of many voices. Thus Nahar alerted his master to the existence of the awakened [[Elves]]. Later, in {{YT|1105}},{{MR|P2g}} when the hosts of the [[Eldalië]] left [[Cuiviénen]], Oromë rode Nahar at their head. After [[Melkor]] and [[Ungoliant]] had attacked the [[Two Trees]] in [[Valinor]] in {{YT|1495}}{{MR|P2j}} a terrible darkness fell upon the land. [[Manwë]] perceived a Darkness beyond dark moving northward and Oromë began a pursuit. The sparks struck from the hooves of Nahar were the first light that returned to Valinor.{{S|Darkening}} ==Genealogy== {{familytree/start}} {{familytree | | | | | NAH | | | | |NAH='''NAHAR'''
